column4: Help! I just installed Ubuntu! Neither my Intel Ethernet card or my Broadcom wireless work. How can I compile the drivers I find on the internet?
I know how to compile them, but Ubuntu doesn't come with sources
Intel Pro/100
Yeah
Yeah it's a laptop?  Which one?
Compaq V6000
That was your first mistake ;)
OK, hold on
All fixes I can find for wifi require wired internet, which I don't have either
It doesn't make any sense to me that it doesn't work, as AFAIK the drivers for both these things are quite mature and should be included in the distribution
I'm looking for information about your drivers, wait one
The ethernet is possibly due to a faulty cable
But I obviously can't have a faulty cable for broadcom wifi
OK, for starters, who told you you had Intel Pro/100 Ethernet on this machine?
You have NVidia integrated Ethernet.  http://www.linux-noob.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=2798
There's a forum post there about getting it to work.
starkruzr- My windows device manager told me that
It apparently lies :p
You've got an NVidia chipset there.  Doesn't make any sense that you'd have Intel Ethernet.
(Considering the AMD chip)
It has a big intel sticker on the front of the laptop
Dude, what?  What does it say?
Centrino/
